|ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Realtek;RTL8366SR;RTL8366SR, 9AH29S1, G942B TAIWAN; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = E0:CB:4E |oui = E0:CB:4E |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-Boot;1.1.3;; |stockos = Linux;2.4.30;; |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2 |pwr_barrel_len = 10 |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, unpopulated,, J1,, 3.3V TTL,, (57600 8N1) |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Richwave;RTC6694;188, 6694, A947;2;SiGe;QFN24; |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = ASUS |defaultssid_regex = ^ASUS$ |default_ch = |manuf = Pegatron |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt (Was) |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/02/2008 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 610839789023 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B001L80CS0 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Ralink;RT2820;RT2820L, C0W4110E0, 0950ST; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The '''[[ASUS]]''' logo, "RT-N15", "REV: 1.10", and "PCB MADE IN TAIWAN" is silkscreened on the board below. The power adapter included with the device is a '''UMEC''' UP0181B-05PA (5V, 2.5A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. ==Links of Interest== ===Wikis=== *{{Wikidevi|Asus_RT-N15}} *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/asus/rt-n15 On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Asus_RT-N15 On the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] ===Forums=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=38533 ''Asus RT-N15 support'' on '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=38533 Support Thread] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|wip}} {{DDWRTNotice|k26req}} {{DDWRT |techdata = |wikipage = https://wiki.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Asus_RT-N15 |forumpage = https://forum.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=1007329 |forumpage2 = https://forum.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=775606 |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = rt-n15 build 16023 20110113 |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} The device is stitched from windows Firmware update in an official insertion (the version of an insertion 1.0.0.7) Firmware files can be found here: [[Project:DD-WRT/Firmware FAQ#Where do I download firmware.3F|Where do I download firmware?]] (asus-rt-n15 folder). Use the factory-to-ddwrt.trx to flash from Factory firmware to dd-wrt. ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|wassupported}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/asus/asus_rt-n15 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/asus/rt-n15 |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = rt288x |arch = mipsel_mips32r2 |support_started_version = 14.07 |current_supported_version = 19.07.10 |image_too_big = snapshot |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = Image build disabled in master with commit d7d46da938e3 }} Please insert instructions here ==Upgrading== ===Upgrading dd-wrt=== Firmware files can be found here: [[Project:DD-WRT/Firmware FAQ#Where do I download firmware.3F|Where do I download firmware?]] (asus-rt-n15 folder). Use the asus-rt-n15-ddwrt-webflash.bin file to upgrade dd-wrt to a newer version. ==Reverting== ===Reverting dd-wrt=== To restore the device to factory firmware, you need to put it in Recovery Mode. # Download the factory firmware # In dd-wrt, reset to factory defaults, through the GUI or CLI. # Disconnect everything from the router, except the power cord. # Push and hold the Reset button with the router powered on. Without releasing the Reset button, unplug the router. # Wait until the power light starts blinking, then release the Reset button. # (Not tested, most likely access a webpage at 192.168.0.1 or 192.168.1.1) We launch program Restoration Firmware, we select a file with an insertion, we stitch. # (Not tested) Browse to the factory firmware file. Click the Upload button. # (Not tested) Wait at least 5 minutes before touching the power cord. # (Not tested) Do a factory reset once the router comes back up successfully. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== This router does not have JTAG. ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
J1
[3.3]
(RxD) --> to RT2880
(TxD)
(GND)
{{/Serial info}} ====Serial Recovery==== See [[Project:DD-WRT/Serial Recovery|Serial Recovery]] ==Pictures==
